WorkItem.Description: Somehow, the Rimetooth Pendant is showing as a better upgrade as non-heroic than heroic. This result is persisting through upgrade lists, manual evaluation, cache updates, and even upgrading from .20 to .21.

Comments.Message: I'm currently showing that the non-heroic is lower than your Wodin's Lucky Necklace and the Heroic being higher. Only suggestion I can come up with is to temporarily change your idol to mutilation and see if that work. Also try starting a new file and see if it persists with that.

Sorry, I guess I wasn't being too specific. I tend to ignore the direct upgrade lists shown on the right pane. I'm talking about the optimizer's Build Upgrade List, and the Evaluate Upgrade option on an item's right-click menu. Both of those show the non-heroic as being more of an upgrade than the heroic.

Hinalover, are you looking at the comparison chart?  Given the file, that's the only place I am finding Rimetooth Pendant [264] is higher than Rimetooth Pendant [251].

Also of note, she is optimizing for DPS Rating.

I have Solitha's Rawr 2.3.21 (she uses it from a thumb drive) and my recently-compiled 2.3.21+ side by side and am getting the same results, so it's not an item cache issue.

The file she uploaded has a DPS rating of 15301.  Evaluating upgrade for the [264] pendant brings her to 15355.  Evaluating for the [251] pendant brings her to 15370.  However, optimizing with just the [264] available found a 15448 that was not found when optimizing with both the [264] and the [251] available.

This may be a case of the disclaimer in the optimizer options: "Even at maximum thoroughness, finding the best possible gearset is not guaranteed, just very likely."  This is probably just one of those few cases the best possible gearset wasn't found.
Yeah, that's why I'm not too sure it's a thoroughness issue. I'm used to running the optimizer several times around, but I've had this come up like 3 times on the upgrade list now.
Finally ran another copy of the upgrade list after deleting or accidentally closing without saving the other 3.
